{"step_by_step_thinking": "Locally advanced breast cancer refers to breast cancer that has spread to nearby tissues but has not yet spread to distant organs. It is typically characterized by a larger tumor size, involvement of the chest wall, and/or skin involvement. Inflammatory breast cancer is a specific subtype of locally advanced breast cancer that presents with redness, swelling, and warmth of the breast, often without a distinct tumor mass. Therefore, the answer choice that does not classify as locally advanced breast cancer is A. Tumor more than 4cm, as this is a common criterion used to define locally advanced breast cancer.", "answer_choice": "A"}
